intro: Ctenopaepale, commonly known as the silky flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, silken leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Ctenopaepale is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
